clinical_study.brief_title: Identifying and Measuring Depression in Older Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Identifying and Measuring Depression in Older Cancer Patients

collaborator.agency: Weill Medical College of Cornell University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to develop an accurate and useful way of measuring older patients' moods and reactions to the combined issue of cancer treatment and aging.

primary_outcome.measure: develope psychometric assessment of a self report measure of depression
primary_outcome.description: This protocol aims to design, develop and pilot test a psychometric assessment for depression in older cancer patients.

primary_outcome.measure: identify differences in item endorsement between younger and older cancer patients on existing depression measures.
primary_outcome.description: These participants will be asked to complete several existing depression measures.

arm_group.description: This protocol aims to design, develop and pilot test a psychometric assessment for depression in older cancer patients. This study is comprised of three parts. 1 - Patient Interviews to Explore the Phenomenology of Depression in Older Cancer Patients. 1A- the research team will complete qualitative interviews with 15 depressed and 15 non-depressed older cancer patients.Part 1B- Phase 1b will include recruitment of 50 younger (age range 50 - 69) and 50 older (age >70) cancer patients at MSK. These participants will be asked to complete several existing depression measures.Part 2 - Instrument Development and EvaluationPart 3 - Pilot Testing the Draft Measure

study_pop.textblock: Recruitment of patients will take place at MSKCC, in ambulatory care areas (i.e., prostate, breast, lung, colorectal, hepatobiliary, head and neck cancers, and palliative medicine) or through the mail using letter recruitment procedures for letter recruitment.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Current or previous cancer diagnosis and treatment (any site and any stage)
- All parts 1,2,3- 70 years of age or older
- For part 1b only; 50 participants ages 50-69 will also be recruited
- In the judgment of the consenting professional able to communicate, comprehend, and complete questionnaires in English
Exclusion Criteria:
- In the judgment of the consenting professional and/or as per medical record, severe psychopathology or cognitive impairment likely to interfere with the participation or completion of the protocol or ability to provide meaningful information.
- Score of > 11 on the Blessed Orientation-Memory-Concentration Scale (BOMC)
- For Part 2 only: Participation in the Part 1 portion of the study
- For Part 3 only: Participation in the Part 1 or 2 portion of the study
